format numeric cells

colformat_num.Rd

Format numeric cells in a flextable.

colformat_num(x, ...)

# S3 method for flextable
colformat_num(
  x,
  j = NULL,
  col_keys = NULL,
  big.mark = ",",
  digits = 2,
  na_str = "",
  prefix = "",
  suffix = "",
  ...
)

Arguments

x

a flextable object
...

additional arguments, i can be used to specify a row selector.
j

columns selection.
col_keys

names of the colkeys. Will be deprectated in favor of j in the next version.
big.mark, digits

see formatC
na_str

string to be used for NA values
prefix

string to be used as prefix or suffix
suffix

string to be used as prefix or suffix

See also

Other cells formatters: colformat_char(), colformat_int(), colformat_lgl(), compose()

Examples

dat <- iris
dat[1:4, 1] <- NA
dat[, 2] <- dat[, 2] * 1000000

ft <- flextable(dat)
colkeys = c("Sepal.Length", "Sepal.Width",
            "Petal.Length", "Petal.Width")
ft <- colformat_num(
  x = ft, col_keys = colkeys,
  big.mark=",", digits = 2, na_str = "N/A")
#> Warning: argument col_keys is deprecated in favor of argument j
autofit(ft)
#> a flextable object.
#> col_keys: `Sepal.Length`, `Sepal.Width`, `Petal.Length`, `Petal.Width`, `Species` 
#> header has 1 row(s) 
#> body has 150 row(s) 
#> original dataset sample: 
#>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species
#> 1           NA     3500000          1.4         0.2  setosa
#> 2           NA     3000000          1.4         0.2  setosa
#> 3           NA     3200000          1.3         0.2  setosa
#> 4           NA     3100000          1.5         0.2  setosa
#> 5            5     3600000          1.4         0.2  setosa
